Class ScreeningAddEditViewController

java.lang.Object
com.example.theaterproject.Controllers.ScreeningAddEditViewController
public class ScreeningAddEditViewController extends Object
Controller for the screening add/edit dialog view.

Manages creation and editing of screenings for a given showroom. Provides input validation for date, time, ticket count, and price, and returns the resulting Screening to the caller.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the controller after FXML loading. Sets up validation listeners and spinner value factories.

    • setupInputValidationListeners

      private void setupInputValidationListeners()
      Registers input validation listeners for price, ticket count, and time spinners. Ensures numeric formats and bounds are respected in text fields and spinner editors.

    • setupSpinnerFactories

      private void setupSpinnerFactories()
      Configures spinner factories for hours (0-23) and minutes (0-59).

    • onSaveButtonClick

      private void onSaveButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Handles the save button click. Validates inputs and creates the result screening if all checks pass.
      Parameters:
      pEvent - the action event from the save button

    • onCancelButtonClick

      private void onCancelButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Handles the cancel action by closing the dialog window.
      Parameters:
      pEvent - the action event from the cancel button

    • validateAndGetMovie

      private Movie validateAndGetMovie()
      Validates and retrieves the selected movie for the screening. Shows an alert if no movie is selected.
      Returns:
      the selected Movie, or null if invalid

    • validateDate

      private boolean validateDate()
      Validates the screening date. Ensures a date is selected and is not in the past.
      Returns:
      true if valid; otherwise false

    • validateTicketCount

      private boolean validateTicketCount()
      Validates the ticket count input. Ensures the value is a positive integer within reasonable bounds.
      Returns:
      true if valid; otherwise false

    • validatePrice

      private boolean validatePrice()
      Validates the ticket price input. Ensures the value is a non-negative decimal under a set maximum.
      Returns:
      true if valid; otherwise false

    • createScreening

      private void createScreening(Movie selectedMovie, javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Creates the resulting Screening from validated inputs and stores it. Closes the dialog on success.
      Parameters:
      selectedMovie - the validated selected movie
      pEvent - the action event used to close the window

    • setScreeningView

      public void setScreeningView(Showroom pShowroom, Screening pScreening)
      Sets up the view for creating or editing a screening in the given showroom. Populates UI controls based on the current context.
      Parameters:
      pShowroom - the showroom associated with the screening
      pScreening - the screening to edit; null for a new screening

    • getResultScreening

      public Screening getResultScreening()
      Retrieves the screening created or edited by this dialog.
      Returns:
      the resulting Screening, or null if none

    • fillView

      private void fillView()
      Fills the view controls with movies and default or existing screening data.

    • populateExistingScreening

      private void populateExistingScreening()
      Populates controls with the values from an existing screening being edited.

    • populateNewScreeningDefaults

      private void populateNewScreeningDefaults()
      Populates default values for a new screening based on showroom and service settings.
